title: 'Slapped my mother, set her on fire': Son’s shocking account in Greater Noida ‘dowry’ death; husband held
content: In Greater Noida, a six-year-old witnessed his mother's horrific murder by his father and grandparents, who doused her in liquid, slapped her, and set her ablaze due to dowry demands. Nikki succumbed to her injuries in a Delhi hospital. Her husband has been arrested, while the other family members are on the run, facing charges of murder and conspiracy.

title: Cheteshwar Pujara retires: A look back at his iconic career and records - in numbers
content: Cheteshwar Pujara, known for his resilience and unwavering defense, retires from Indian cricket, marking the end of an era defined by grit and patience. Over 103 Tests, he amassed 7,195 runs, becoming a symbol of steadfastness at the No. 3 position.

title: India successfully tests maiden flight of Integrated Air Defence Weapon system; watch
content: The Defence Research and Development Organisation (DRDO) successfully conducted maiden flight tests of the Integrated Air Defence Weapon System (IADWS) off the Odisha coast on August 23, 2025. This multi-layered air defence platform integrates indigenous components like QRSAM, VSHORADS, and a Directed Energy Weapon.

title: Rahul Gandhi and RJD's Tejashwi Yadav ride bikes in Purnea; watch
content: Rahul Gandhi and Tejashwi Yadav rode motorbikes during their "Vote Adhikaar Yatra" in Bihar, aiming to address concerns about voter roll irregularities. The Yatra, spanning over 1,300 kilometres, seeks to mobilize people against alleged manipulation in the electoral roll revision process, which the opposition claims targets poor, minorities, and migrant workers, leading to vote theft.

title: AWS CEO: Firing junior devs for AI is "dumbest thing ever"
content: Amazon Web Services CEO, Matthew Garman, has strongly criticised companies for replacing junior staff with artificial intelligence. He calls it a bad idea. Garman warns this strategy could harm future talent. He highlights that junior employees are cost-effective. They also adopt AI tools readily. His comments challenge the industry's view on AI's impact on entry-level jobs.

title: Pujara retirement: What is written on his goodbye post? Read inside
content: Cheteshwar Pujara, a celebrated Test batter for India, has announced his retirement from international cricket after a remarkable career spanning over a decade. The 37-year-old concluded his journey with 7,195 runs in 103 Tests and an impressive 21,301 first-class runs. He expressed gratitude to the BCCI, teammates, family, and fans for their unwavering support throughout his career.

title: 'To counter China, US must ... ': Nikki Haley's message to India over Russian oil
content: Nikki Haley suggests India should address Donald Trump's tariff concerns. She highlights the need for dialogue regarding Russian oil imports. Haley views India as essential for the US, especially in countering China. She emphasizes India's growing economic importance and young workforce. Haley advocates for strengthening the US-India partnership. She believes resolving trade issues is crucial for shared goals.

title: Big blow! Australia pacer out for 12 months, set to miss Ashes series - here's why
content: Australian fast bowler Lance Morris is set to miss the Ashes series and will be sidelined for 12 months following back surgery. The 27-year-old, who was a potential backup pace option, withdrew from the South Africa one-day series due to lower back discomfort. Tests revealed a lumbar bone stress injury, prompting the surgery.

title: Investor alert: OpenAI issues warning on fake firms
content: Amidst the AI investment frenzy, OpenAI cautions investors about firms falsely claiming affiliations to attract funding. Fueled by FOMO and opaque partnerships, these deceptive practices inflate valuations and mislead investors. The warning highlights the need for thorough verification and vigilance against potential bubble trouble in the rapidly growing AI sector.

title: Olympian questions Sharad Pawar Museum naming - 'Wish it was named after cricketer'
content: The newly unveiled MCA Sharad Pawar Cricket Museum at Wankhede Stadium, while lauded for its design and exhibits, has stirred debate over its naming. Viren Rasquinha's comment sparked discussion about honoring administrators versus players. The museum celebrates Mumbai's cricketing history, featuring interactive displays and memorabilia, opening to the public on September 22, 2025.

title: Ahmedabad school murder: ‘My son’s killer deserves nothing less than hanging'
content: Following the tragic stabbing death of Nayan Santani at a school in Maninagar, his father, Girish Santani, expressed his grief and demanded the harshest punishment for the perpetrators during a condolence meet. He criticized the school's negligence and called for its closure, while political figures assured strict action and emphasized maintaining law and order.

title: Telangana teacher mixes pesticide in drinking water: 11 students fall ill
content: In Jayashankar Bhupalpally, a teacher allegedly poisoned drinking water with pesticide, targeting rival teachers. Eleven students fell ill after consuming the contaminated water and were hospitalized. The accused, Rajender, aimed to frame Venu and Suryaprakash amidst school dominance struggles, leading to his suspension along with the other two teachers and the cook.

title: Apple Wallet adds digital driver’s licenses: Now live in 10 US states
content: Apple Wallet is changing how Americans use IDs. Now, people in some states can keep their driver's licenses on their iPhones and Apple Watches. Montana is the latest state to join. This means more people can use their phones to show ID at airports and businesses. Apple wants to replace wallets with a digital system.

title: ‘They wanted Rs 36 lakh’: Woman tortured, set ablaze by in-laws in Greater Noida
content: In Greater Noida's Sirsa village, Nikki, a 26-year-old woman, tragically died after allegedly being set ablaze by her husband and in-laws over dowry demands. Her husband, Vipin, is in custody, while other family members are absconding. Nikki's sister, Kanchan, reports years of harassment and violence, despite previous dowry payments.

title: Nayara Energy hit by new US, EU sanctions trouble; EPC work hit - Details
content: EU and US economic restrictions are impacting Nayara Energy's EPC operations, leading firms like Technip Energies and PT Timas Suplindo to withdraw from tenders. Despite no direct sanctions, Nayara faces challenges due to Rosneft's significant ownership.

title: 'When he speaks, his MPs get uncomfortable': Rijiju slams Rahul
content: Union Minister Kiren Rijiju accuses Rahul Gandhi of collaborating with George Soros and anti-India forces to destabilize the nation, calling it a dangerous path. Rijiju also criticized Gandhi's "vote chori" charge, referencing an apology from a CSDS psephologist for data errors, while Gandhi alleges PM Modi is attempting vote theft and betraying the youth.

title: Shreyas Iyer to be ODI captain? Ex-India cricketer – 'It’s already decided'
content: Amidst speculation about India's next ODI captain, Aakash Chopra has dismissed rumors linking Shreyas Iyer to the role. Chopra asserts that Shubman Gill is the likely successor to Rohit Sharma, already holding vice-captaincy in ODIs and leading in Tests. Gill's rise has also shifted Axar Patel from T20 vice-captaincy, solidifying Gill's position as the heir apparent for India's white-ball leadership.

title: Drake passage 2025 earthquake: 7.4-magnitude tremor; world’s most dangerous waters
content: A significant 7.4 magnitude earthquake rattled the Drake Passage on August 22, 2025, triggering tsunami warnings for Antarctic bases. While a widespread tsunami was averted, the event underscores the region's seismic activity and its crucial role in global climate regulation. The passage, notorious for extreme weather and treacherous navigation, is vital for ocean currents and carbon absorption.

title: Serena surprises crowd to introduce Sharapova at Hall of Fame – Watch
content: Serena Williams surprised attendees at the International Tennis Hall of Fame ceremony by introducing Maria Sharapova, acknowledging Sharapova's impact on her career. Williams praised Sharapova's on-court competitiveness and off-court business acumen. Sharapova, inducted alongside doubles legends Mike and Bob Bryan, was recognized for her Grand Slam achievements and world No. 1 ranking.

title: Disasters batter Uttarakhand, children forced to study in crumbling schools
content: For many children, the classroom has become less a place of learning and more a daily struggle for safety-amid collapsing walls, leaking roofs, and the threat of wild animals straying in. Education minister Dhan Singh Rawat, taking cognisance of the issue, recently directed repairs to be completed by March 2026, allotting Rs 2 crore each to seven districts and Rs 1 crore each to the rest six.

title: Hours after SC order, man slaps woman 9 times for feeding stray dogs in Ghaziabad
content: A Ghaziabad resident, Kamal Kishore Khanna, was arrested after a video surfaced showing him repeatedly slapping a woman who was feeding stray dogs. The incident occurred shortly after a Supreme Court order regarding designated feeding spots for strays, sparking concerns about people taking the law into their own hands.

title: Asia Cup 2025: Rashid Khan to lead Afghanistan; full squad announced
content: Afghanistan announced their 17-member squad for the Asia Cup 2025, with Rashid Khan captaining the team. Naveen-ul-Haq returns, bolstering the pace attack alongside Fazalhaq Farooqi and others. The squad blends experienced players like Mohammad Nabi and Gulbadin Naib with promising talents, aiming to challenge established teams and make a significant impact in the tournament.

title: 3-year-old 'kidnapped' Surat boy found murdered in dustbin of train washroom
content: A three-year-old boy, Aarav Shah, who was reported missing from his Surat home on August 21, was tragically discovered murdered in a train lavatory at Lokmanya Tilak Terminus in Mumbai. The child's throat was slit, and authorities are actively searching for his cousin, Vikas Kumar Shah, who is suspected of kidnapping the boy.

title: Bihar: Akhilesh, Stalin, Soren to join Rahul's poll yatra; show oppn unity
content: The 'Voter Adhikar Yatra,' led by Rahul Gandhi and Tejashwi Yadav, is evolving into a significant display of opposition unity. Key regional leaders like MK Stalin and Akhilesh Yadav are slated to participate in the roadshow before its conclusion in Patna on September 1.

title: LeBron James’ awkward golf swing sparks roasts from Shannon Sharpe, NFL Legends
content: LeBron James' foray into golf during the 2025 NBA offseason became a viral sensation, not for his prowess, but for his notably stiff swing. NFL and NBA stars humorously critiqued his form, while fans created memes. Undeterred, James embraced the challenge, vowing to improve and showcasing a relatable side of the basketball icon.

title: ‘Trivial charges’: Shashi Tharoor condemns arrest of ex-Sri Lankan president
content: Shashi Tharoor has expressed his concern over the detention of former Sri Lankan President Ranil Wickremesinghe, deeming the charges against him as trivial. Tharoor urged the Sri Lankan government to refrain from engaging in politics of vengeance and treat Wickremesinghe with respect, considering his long service to the nation.

title: 'I couldn’t get the words out': CSK star on nervous encounter with AB de Villiers
content: Dewald Brevis, South Africa's rising cricket star, recounts his initial encounter with his idol, AB de Villiers. Overwhelmed with nervousness, Brevis struggled to ask for a picture, but de Villiers' wife intervened. This initial meeting, followed by a chance encounter at a school event where Brevis bravely asked for his number, sparked a mentorship that profoundly impacted Brevis's cricketing journey.

title: 'War 2' BO collection Day 10: Hrithik Roshan, Jr NTR-starrer crosses Rs 214 cr mark
content: Hrithik Roshan, Jr NTR, and Kiara Advani's 'War 2' showed slight recovery on its second Saturday, collecting approximately Rs 6.25 crore, bringing its India net total to Rs 214.5 crore. Despite a strong opening, the film faces competition from Rajinikanth's 'Coolie'. 'War 2' has grossed Rs 320 crore worldwide but needs further gains to recoup its Rs 400 crore budget.

title: 'No more begging': PCB chief makes huge claim on cricketing ties with India
content: India and Pakistan are set to clash in the Asia Cup and Women's ODI World Cup. Mohsin Naqvi advocates for equal footing in negotiations with India. Despite reservations in India, engagement is expected in multi-nation tournaments. Earlier agreement involved neutral venues. Pakistan secured concessions, including hosting rights for a future ICC Women's tournament.

title: PCB chief breaks silence on Babar, Rizwan snub - 'Don’t have even 1% role'
content: The Pakistan Cricket Board has announced its squad for the upcoming UAE tri-series and Asia Cup 2025, surprisingly omitting Babar Azam and Mohammad Rizwan. PCB chairman Mohsin Naqvi stated the decision was made by selectors based on merit, emphasizing a focus on power-hitters and a long-term vision to introduce new talent. Salman Ali Agha will captain the team.

title: Bihar SIR: Clock ticking on roll fix; confusion greets SC order
content: Across Bihar, thousands are scrambling to reclaim their place on the rolls before the Sept 1 deadline - a race against time that began when SC Friday opened a narrow window for those struck off during the SIR. Voters can now submit Aadhaar or one of 11 other approved documents, even online, to restore their names.

title: Judge seals filing after Janel Grant medical records leak
content: A legal battle involving Janel Grant, Dr. Carlon Colker, and WWE took a turn when sensitive medical records were briefly exposed online. This occurred during Colker's defamation lawsuit against Grant's attorney, adding complexity to Grant's ongoing abuse and trafficking case against Vince McMahon and WWE. The court has since ordered the document sealed to protect Grant's privacy.

title: Meghan Markle ‘furious’ as Swift–Kelce overshadow her show launch
content: Meghan Markle's attempt to regain spotlight faces challenges. Her Netflix series announcement coincides with Taylor Swift's surprise album release. Reports suggest Markle feels overshadowed by Swift's media attention. The response to Markle's trailer is lukewarm. Swift's dominance continues with Super Bowl speculation. The incident highlights the difficulty in competing with Swift's cultural influence.

title: Sidney Crosby to Bedard: ‘They probably don’t need me’
content: Sidney Crosby, a celebrated leader in Canadian hockey, is preparing for the 2026 Winter Olympics, aiming for another gold while mentoring the next generation, including Connor Bedard. Crosby's influence extends beyond scoring, shaping young players through patience, composure, and leadership. His mentorship ensures Canada's continued success in developing champions for years to come.

title: US Open 2025: 'Sincaraz' in focus again; Sabalenka seeks rare streak
content: The US Open never had a Roger Federer and Rafael Nadal meeting but they would hope the newest rivalry in men's tennis - Carlos Alcaraz vs Jannik Sinner - dubbed "Sincaraz" - would fare differently. On the women's side, defending champion Aryna Sabalenka targets her first major this year, with Iga Swiatek and Coco Gauff two of her biggest rivals.

title: Despite opposition, J&K government assumes control of 215 Jamaat-linked schools
content: Former chief minister and PDP chief Mehbooba Mufti condemned the decision, saying Kashmiris voted the National Conference (NC) to office in the 2024 assembly elections to safeguard their interests, but the party has instead targeted schools that provided quality education in J&K.

title: 'She doesn’t include Blake': Taylor Swift leans on Travis Kelce’s support
content: Taylor Swift's album rollout for 'The Life of a Showgirl' is generating buzz with exclusive listening sessions, sparking speculation about her inner circle. Selena Gomez and Zoë Kravitz have reportedly heard the album, while Blake Lively's absence raises questions. Sources suggest Travis Kelce's support has inspired Swift's bolder image for the October 3 release.

title: 'Coolie' BO Day 10: Rajinikanth starrer mints Rs 10 cr on second Saturday
content: Rajinikanth's 'Coolie,' directed by Lokesh Kanagaraj, continues its box office dominance, earning approximately Rs 10 crore on its second Saturday, bringing its total to Rs 245.50 crore. The film maintains a lead over 'War 2,' driven by strong occupancy in Tamil Nadu and steady numbers in Hindi and Telugu markets, despite mixed reviews regarding the storytelling.

title: NFL preseason takeaways and 53-man roster projections: Najee Harris news makes for crowded RB room for Chargers
content: The final games of the 2025 preseason help flesh out key battles ahead of Tuesday's 53-man roster cuts.

title: Schottenheimer will meet Parsons after lie-down
content: Dallas coach Brian Schottenheimer said Saturday he will meet with Micah Parsons on Sunday to discuss the edge rusher's behavior, after he lay on a medical table behind the Cowboys' bench during Friday's 31-13 preseason victory over the Atlanta Falcons.

title: Cortes silences WS demons, dominates Dodgers
content: The Padres' Nestor Cortes, who gave up the first walk-off grand slam in World Series history in October, faced his Dodgers demons and tossed six brilliant innings in a 5-1 win.

title: 'Unacceptable': Yanks' woes vs. Red Sox continue
content: The Yankees' troublesome struggles against the Red Sox this season continued Saturday in an ugly 12-1 loss at Yankee Stadium.

title: Raiders QB O'Connell breaks wrist, out 6-8 weeks
content: Raiders backup quarterback Aidan O'Connell will need surgery after suffering a fractured right wrist in Saturday's preseason finale and will miss six to eight weeks.

title: Chargers' Harris 'on track' to play W1, GM says
content: Los Angeles Chargers general manager Joe Hortiz said that he is hopeful running back Najee Harris, who has been on the non-football injury/illness list for all of training camp, will play Week 1.

title: Despite tough test, Rebels 'enjoy' Mullen opener
content: Jai'Den Thomas scored three touchdowns, the UNLV defense authored four interceptions, and the heavily favored Rebels held off Idaho State 38-31 on Saturday in the debut of Dan Mullen, an effort the veteran coach and his new club are "going to enjoy."

title: 'Holy grail' MJ-Kobe card sells for record $12.9M
content: A 1-of-1 signed Michael Jordan/Kobe Bryant card broke the record for most expensive sports card sold at auction, closing at $12.932 million Saturday night.

title: 🏈 Adam Schefter's fantasy football cheat sheet
content: No one is more plugged in to the latest buzz around the NFL than Adam Schefter. We asked him to share his favorite values in fantasy drafts with you.

title: Marching bands! Big entrances! Sing-alongs! 36 of our favorite game-day traditions
content: With a new season here, we look at some of the wild, wacky, wonderful reasons we love college football.

title: US Open 2025: Tennis schedule, how to watch on ESPN
content: The 2025 US Open runs from Sunday, Aug. 24 to Sunday, Sept. 7. Check out how to watch top tennis stars in action.

title: Rejuvenated Arsenal look the part of title contenders, but depth could be put to test
content: Viktor Gyökeres scored his first goals as a Gunner and Max Dowman thrilled on his debut, but issues loom after Arsenal's convincing win over Leeds.

title: Who needs Eze? Spurs' win at Man City shows transfers aren't everything
content: Losing out to Arsenal for Eberechi Eze was humbling for Spurs. But maybe they've already made their signing of the summer.

title: Preseason report cards for every single rookie selected in the 2025 NFL draft
content: How did Hunter look in training camp? What's next for Shough? We checked in on all 32 teams' rookie classes.

title: Walker tops Zhang at UFC Fight Night in Shanghai
content: Johnny Walker ended a skid of two straight knockout losses by scoring a shocking knockout of his own.

title: Projecting the NFL's sack leaders for 2025: Which pass rushers will get after the QB this season?
content: Will Aidan Hutchinson, Micah Parsons or Trey Hendrickson lead the NFL in sacks? Seth Walder projects this season's top sack-getters.

title: Red Sox in must-win mode? Are Yankees back? What you should -- and shouldn't -- believe in the American League
content: How big is this series with New York for Boston? Is Toronto the best team in the AL? We give verdicts on what it all means.

title: How a swing tweak took Roman Anthony to the next level
content: The Red Sox rookie made his Yankee Stadium debut with a bang, but lately, he has been pummeling everybody.

title: 📉 Barnwell picks five NFL teams set to decline
content: Which teams will take a step back and lose more games this season? We made five picks based on troubling signs, offseason subtractions and more.

title: 💰 Jones: Offer to Parsons was richest for non-QB
content: Jerry Jones said the agreement he believed he made with Micah Parsons would have been the richest ever for a non-quarterback, adding, "Nobody has ever offered him more money than I have to play football. Period."

title: ⛳ Rory: Took home 1,100 Masters flags after win
content: Rory McIlroy said he took all 1,100 pin flags from the Masters Shop after winning at Augusta National in April. "I've waited 17 years to sign that flag in the middle, and I will never complain about doing it."

title: 'We are what we drive': How car dealers became college football's power brokers
content: More college football players are driving sports cars than ever before. But the connection between dealers and programs goes back decades.

title: Inside Arch Manning's wild recruitment saga
content: Getting the heir to football's QB dynasty to commit was destined to be crazy. But this was even beyond that.

title: PLL quarterfinals preview: Key stats, matchups, how to watch
content: Which teams will advance to take on the Atlas and Outlaws in the next round? Here's what you need to know.

title: High school coach? Ayesha Curry opens up on spouse Stephen Curry's early career goal
content: Ayesha Curry, who is married to two-time NBA MVP Stephen Curry, revealed he wanted to be a high school basketball coach.

title: Russell Westbrook makes music video cameo with Ciara
content: The NBA free agent made a surprise cameo, showing off his moves alongside the Grammy Award-winning singer.

title: LeBron, KD and an unprecedented next chapter in their 20-year rivalry
content: For two decades, the two superstars have led superteams to NBA glory. Now, for the first time, they're both looking up at one -- and perhaps the best one yet.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Aston Villa eye Chelsea's Nkunku
content: Rasmus Højlund has moved a step closer to leaving Manchester United for a return to Serie A. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: The best worst transfers: Why the likes of Sancho, Werner were actually smart signings
content: Sometimes, a transfer should work out, but doesn't. Here are the best worst transfers over the past decade.

title: Reid's annual HBCU watch list: Ranking the top 10 prospects for the 2026 NFL draft
content: Ahead of Saturday's Cricket MEAC/SWAC Challenge Kickoff, we ranked 10 HBCU players who could be on next year's NFL draft radar.

title: "I Want Encounter": UP Dowry Victim's Father Appeals To Yogi Adityanath
content: The father of 28-year-old Nikki Bhati, who died after her husband and in-laws allegedly set her on fire over a Rs 36-lakh dowry demand, has demanded that the accused be shot dead in an encounter and their house be razed as punishment

title: How Rekha Jhunjhunwala's Nazara Exit Ahead Of Gaming Bill Saved Her Rs 334 Crore
content: Star investor Rekha Jhunjhunwala offloaded her entire stake in Nazara Technologies in June, well before the government's Online Gaming Bill led to a sharp selloff in the stock.

title: "How Do You Give Permission": Uddhav Thackeray To Centre On India-Pak Match
content: Shiv Sena (UBT) chief Uddhav Thackeray targeted the Union government and the Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) for allowing the Indian team to play with Pakistan in the Asia Cup.

title: "Sweating, Babbling": British Airways Staff Found Naked, High In Flight Toilet
content: A British Airways flight attendant was found naked inside a toilet of an aircraft, while under the alleged influence of drugs during a flight from California to London.

title: "Dangerous Track": Kiren Rijiju Says Rahul Gandhi Working With George Soros
content: Union Minister Kiren Rijiju on Saturday took a strong jibe at Congress leader Rahul Gandhi for following a "very dangerous track", and accused the Leader of the Opposition in Lok Sabha of working in coordination with "anti-India" George Soros.

title: 'Spiderman' Goes On Stunt Spree On Bike In Odisha, Issued Rs 15,000 Fine
content: Dressing and acting like "Spiderman" to perform dangerous stunts on a road proved to be costly for a man in Odisha's Rourkela after he was issued a fine of Rs 15,000 for a series of traffic violations.

title: 15 Pakistani Fishermen Arrested Near Border In Gujarat's Kori Creek
content: In a coordinated maritime operation, 15 Pakistani fishermen were arrested along with one engine-fitted country boat in the Kori Creek area, Gujarat, near the Border Outpost (BOP) BBK by the Border Security Force (BSF) and the Indian Coast Guard.

title: Delhi Court Orders Prioritising Cases Of Armed Forces, Paramilitary Personnel
content: The Chief Justice instructed all district and sessions courts in Delhi to ensure early hearings and expeditious disposal of civil, revenue, and criminal cases related to members of the armed forces.

title: India Conducts Maiden Flight Tests of Integrated Air Defence Weapon System
content: The Defence Research and Development Organisation (DRDO) has successfully carried out the maiden flight tests of the Integrated Air Defence Weapon System (IADWS), Defence Minister Rajnath Singh announced on Sunday.

title: 11 Killed In Rain, Floods, Landslides Across India, Jharkhand Worst Hit
content: At least 11 people were killed and several were injured in the last 24 hours in incidents related to heavy rains in several parts of the country, including Jammu and Kashmir and Tamil Nadu.

title: Pentagon Restricts Ukraine's Use Of US Missiles Against Russia: Report
content: The Pentagon has been quietly blocking Ukraine from using US-made long-range Army Tactical Missile Systems (ATACMS) to strike targets inside Russia.

title: "When I Get Angry...": Congress MLA Accused Of Harassment To Pregnant Woman
content: Congress MLA Rahul Mamkootathil, who faces several allegations of sexual misconduct, allegedly forced a woman to undergo an abortion and threatened to kill her in a "few seconds" when she resisted his demand.

title: After Washington, Trump Planning Military Deployment In Chicago: Report
content: The Pentagon is working on plans to deploy the US military to Chicago as President Donald Trump says he is cracking down on crime, homelessness and undocumented immigration.

title: "Unauthorised Alien": Indian-Origin Truck Driver Behind US Crash Denied Bail
content: Harjinder Singh, 28, faces three counts of vehicular homicide for allegedly making an illegal U-turn in his tractor-trailer that caused the deadly crash in Fort Pierce on August 12.

title: 'Top Court's Order': INDIA Bloc's Veep Nominee On Amit Shah's 'Supporting' Maoist Charge
content: Sudershan Reddy, along with Justice S S Nijjar, was part of a Supreme Court bench that had in July 2011 ordered the disbanding of Salwa Judum.

title: India Is In A Position To Help Lift The World Out Of Slow Growth: PM Modi
content: The Prime Minister said India is working with full force toward its goal of becoming a developed nation by 2047, and the basis of a developed India is a self-reliant India.

title: Exclusive Business Chamber 'The Imperial' Launched At Adani Shantigram In Ahmedabad
content: Gujarat has a new address for enterprise and culture with the launch of The Imperial'  Opulent Business Chamber at the Belvedere Golf and Country Club in Adani Shantigram, said Adani Realty, the real estate arm of the diversified Adani Group.

title: "Trivial Charges": Shashi Tharoor On Ex-Sri Lanka President Ranil Wickramasinghe's Arrest
content: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor on Sunday expressed concern about the arrest of former Sri Lankan President Ranil Wickramasinghe and called on Colombo to "abjure the politics of vengeance".

title: "Slapped Her, Set Her On Fire": Son On Mother's Murder Over Rs 36 Lakh Dowry In Noida
content: A woman on fire was seen limping down a flight of stairs in a haunting video captured hours before she died on her way to a hospital in Delhi on Thursday.

title: Syrian Man In Gujarat Raises Funds For Gaza, Spends On His Lavish Lifestyle
content: A Syrian national who was raising funds from mosques here purportedly for the needy residents of war-torn Gaza has been arrested while his three compatriots are absconding, the city police said on Saturday.

title: TMC, SP won't join JPC on bill on dismissal of PM & CMs

title: Cosmic origin: Did comets play a role in shaping Earth?
content: The TOI Science Desk stands as an inquisitive team of journalists, ceaselessly delving into the realms of discovery to curate a captivating collection of news, features, and articles from the vast and ever-evolving world of science for the readers of The Times of India. title: Global warming curbing workers' productivity: WHO
content: a warming planet is weighing on workers' health and productivity, study finds . last year was the hottest on record, according to the world health organization . the heat is curbing workers' productivity, which drops by 2% to 3% for every degree above 20C .

title: Maharashtra to register women cooperative, give government contracts: CM Fadnavis
content: The Chief Minister clarified that none of the welfare schemes announced before the 2024 State Assembly elections would be discontinued for the next five years

title: BJP worker arrested for beating Scheduled Caste engineer with shoe in U.P.’s Ballia
content: BJP District president Sanjay Mishra confirmed that Munna Bahadur is a party worker and the Superintendent of Police said Bahadur and others with him were booked

title: Student charred to death in Arunachal residential school fire, three others injured
content: A probe is underway to ascertain the cause of the fire as the village does not have power connectivity

title: Gaganyaan mission symbol of new chapter in journey of Atmanirbhar Bharat, says Rajnath Singh
content: At an event hosted by the IAF at Subroto Park in New Delhi, the Defence Minister felicitated the four Gaganyatris.

title: Bus catches fire on Mumbai-Goa highway, narrow escape for 44 passengers
content: Before the Kashedi tunnel, a tyre burst and it caught fire, following which the bus driver applied emergency brakes and asked all the passengers to get down, the official said

title: BSF apprehends 15 Pakistani fishermen near border in Gujarat's Kutch
content: The BSF carried out a search operation on Saturday (August 23) on the basis of a specific information regarding an unidentified boat found in the general area of the border outpost

title: Maharashtra Minister asks Jarange to hold talks with Govt ahead of protests
content: Jarange called for a protest at Azad Maidan in south Mumbai from August 29, demanding reservation for the Maratha community under the Other Backward Classes (OBC) category

title: Flash floods in Himachal Pradesh threaten trout fish
content: The department of Fisheries has urged the State Government to include trout farmers under the disaster relief manual

title: DRDO successfully conducts maiden flight tests of Integrated Air Defence Weapon System
content: “This unique flight test has established the multi-layered air-defence capability of our country and is going to strengthen area defence for important facilities against enemy aerial threats,” says Rajnath Singh

title: In Frames: Long-playing vintage tuning hands
content: R. Sundaravadanan, fondly known as Stylus Mani, repairs and refurbishes styluses and turntables at his home workshop in Thiruvananthapuram, keeping the music of the past alive

title: Crediting care work: a T.N. story
content: While the disparity in payment for male and female workers remains as stark as ever, the Tamil Nadu government’s Kalaignar Mahalir Urimai Thogai scheme recognises the unpaid labour, giving many women dignity, self-respect, and financial independence. title: Bail out distressed tenant farmers, former bureaucrat writes to A.P. govt.
content: State government should take up a study involving experts, analyse the reasons for farmer suicides and formulate pro-farmer policies within two months, he says

title: AAP MP Ashok Mittal calls for boycott of U.S. soft drink companies at LPU over tariff hike
content: Lovely Professional University in Punjab to ban U.S. companies’ soft drinks if tariffs on Indian goods comes into effect

title: Indian-origin truck driver facing homicide charges in U.S. denied bond
content: Harjinder Singh was charged with three state counts of vehicular homicide and immigration violations, and he was denied bond on all charges

title: ‘No bag day’ is to encourage students to be creative’
content: Observed every fourth Saturday, no-bag day or bagless day, as per National Education Policy 2020, is for enrichment of students with activities including vocational crafts, or a visit to a place of importance

title: Greater Noida woman killed for ₹36 lakh dowry, husband held
content: A woman was assaulted and set on fire by her husband and in-laws in Greater Noida over a dowry; a case was registered against the victim’s husband and his family at Kasna Police Station

title: Nearly 1.5 lakh benefited from ‘Nalam Kaakkum Stalin’ camps in three weeks, says CM
content: Stalin highlighted the response to the Nalam Kaakkum Stalin camps, which have been conducted across the State every Saturday since August 2

title: 1.48 lakh cases of traffic violation settled, ₹4.18 cr. collected on day 1

title: India in position to help lift the world out of slow growth: PM Modi
content: The Prime Minister outlines India’s economic growth, reforms, and self-reliance goals to lift global growth

title: IISc team finds ancient proteins that hint at life’s leap in complexity
content: A pair of unusual proteins in archaea have revealed how cells first experimented with the structures that shape higher life

title: Tobacco control laws are out of step with smokeless tobacco
content: Achieving the tobacco endgame in India requires a coordinated strategy across multiple ministries, alongside stringent implementation of existing laws, increased taxes, and stronger research bodies

title: DMK government has failed to follow proper protocol in DGP appointment, says Palaniswami

title: Fear of terrorists has almost ended in Kashmir: L-G Manoj Sinha

title: Huntington’s Disease Society of India calls for urgent government action for inclusion under National Rare Diseases Policy
content: The first meeting of the task force, which has been formed to discuss the action plan for HD, dementia and other neurodegenerative disorders, will be held on August 25

title: Census 2027 to retain 2011 Census definition of an urban area
content: An urban unit or a ‘census town’ is defined as ‘all other villages’ with a minimum population of 5,000 people with a density of population of 400 persons per sq. km. and where 75% of the male working population is engaged in non-agricultural pursuits

title: A.P. sand artist to depict story of Lord Ganesh through 15 sculptures

title: India-Bangladesh Land Boundary Agreement 2015 | 10 years of Indian citizenship
content: The historic Land Boundary Agreement in 2015, which led to the swap of enclaves between India and Bangladesh, granted citizenship to about 15,000 people who had felt stateless for almost seven decades. title: Five-year-old tribal boy dies of fever in Koodalarkudy in Idukki

title: Why guaranteed money, late signings for second-round picks are an NFL trend to watch
content: the NFLPA filed a grievance alleging the league colluded to limit fully guaranteed player contracts . the players received a substantial windfall in the second round of this year's draft . they benefit from fully guaranteed contracts for seven players in the round .

title: 2025 preseason College Football Playoff predictions

title: Six unlikely CFP stars and what they do for an encore
content: wide receiver Jaden Greathouse will be different as no. 6 Notre Dame opens the season at no. 10 Miami . Greathouse entered the college football playoff semifinal at the orange bowl with only six receptions for 49 yards in his previous five games . the wide receiver had a career-high 66 receiving yards for the season .

title: Bucs' Sanders ejected after 'inexcusable' punch
content: Shilo Sanders ejected from third preseason game against the Buffalo Bills . undrafted free agent is competing for a spot on the 53-man roster or the practice squad . he punched tight end Zach Davidson after heavy pushing and shoving .

title: US Open odds: Sinner favored on men's side, Swiatek top choice on women's side
content: The defending US Open champions on the men's and women's sides are at or near the top of the odds for the tournament's 145th edition in their quests to repeat. Jannik Sinner , who won the Wimbledon men's singles championship last month, is +105 to claim his second US Open title in a row.  Carlos Alcaraz , his opponent in the Wimbledon final, is the second choice at +180. On the women's side,  Iga Swiatek  (+250), this year's Wimbledon champ and the 2022 US Open winner, is a slight favorite over defending champion  Aryna Sabalenka  (+270) in the final Grand Slam of the year. Singles play runs Sunday through Sept. 7, with ESPN providing coverage of the event on its networks. The women's final will be played Saturday, Sept. 6 at  4 p.m. ET on ESPN , and the men's final takes place the following day at 2 p.m. ET on ABC. Every tournament match will stream live on the ESPN App.
